evidence_gaps.description: Some events may lack direct evidence file references
evidence_gaps.recommendation: Cross-reference all events with ad-res-j7 repository files and add specific file paths to evidence arrays

evidence_gaps.description: Timeline events involving third parties (Linda, Gee, etc.) could be strengthened with witness statements
evidence_gaps.recommendation: Identify events where witness testimony would corroborate documentary evidence

cross_application_opportunities.description: Events supporting both Application 1 (Ex Parte) and Application 2 (Settlement) demonstrate ongoing pattern
cross_application_opportunities.recommendation: Emphasize the continuity of misconduct from Application 1 through Application 2 to show bad faith in settlement negotiations

cross_application_opportunities.description: Application 3 (Contact Interdict) represents escalation after failed settlement
cross_application_opportunities.recommendation: Frame Application 3 events as retaliation for enforcement attempts, establishing pattern of obstruction

narrative_enhancements.description: Shopify platform appears in 67% of critical events
narrative_enhancements.recommendation: Create dedicated Shopify timeline visualization showing platform ownership, operation, and hijacking attempts as central narrative thread

narrative_enhancements.description: Multiple family members coordinate across different event categories
narrative_enhancements.recommendation: Develop family network diagram showing coordination between Peter, Rynette, and Addarory across timeline phases

narrative_enhancements.description: Two critical evidence destruction events (May 22, Aug 20) show consciousness of guilt
narrative_enhancements.recommendation: Highlight evidence destruction events as separate timeline track showing awareness of criminality

narrative_enhancements.description: Danie Bantjies R18.75M (Ketoni debt to FFT) debt creates motive throughout timeline
narrative_enhancements.recommendation: Create separate timeline showing Bantjies involvement, debt accumulation, and audit dismissal as parallel narrative
